attributes.action: Actively promote the adoption of 'De Facto' relationships as having equal rights to those of married and civil ceremony couples
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Britain should adopt the same stance as New Zealand (amongst other countries) and recognise that couples who do not wish to get married, but have, by virtue of time, established that they have a de-facto relationship, should be afforded the same rights and privileges as those who have made a commitment under the laws of the land.
